text:
Hello guys. I am an associate professor of Smart Cities and Urban Planning at Universidade Nove de Julho located in São Paulo Brazil. I currently advise PhD candidates and also teach graduates and undergraduates in Stats, Bayesian Stats, Machine Learning, Deep Learning. My main focus (and passion) is probabilistic languages and Bayesian Statistics. I currently contribute to Stan and I am also looking to help in turing.

I've been dabbling with Julia for 2 years now. From 2021 onwards I realized that Julia is the future of scientific computing and everything new I am doing it in Julia with research, classes, students and candidates.

Such a welcoming community. I would like to express my deepest gratitude and I am here to contribute and help as much as I can.

text: Channels you may find interesting: <#CN04R7WKE|sciml-bridged> <#CLR9W2MJL|probprog> (and <#CCYDC34A0|turing> and <#CN8J6LZNC|soss> ... a lot of discussion for baysian stuff also happens <https://julialang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/234072-probprog|on zulip>), <#CC57ZE7EY|mlj>

attachments.title: JuliaLang
attachments.text: This is the Zulip server for the Julia programming language community. We ask anyone joining to adhere to the Julia Code of Conduct. | To learn more about Julia, check out <https://julialang.org/>, or just come ask us here! | You can reach out to the admins of this Zulip by sending a direct message to @zulip-admins.

elements.text: ... a lot of discussion for baysian stuff also happens

text:
Thank you <@U69BL50BF>. You are an inspiration. I am also a young scholar and lecturer, but you are way out of my league... :joy:

<@U8JP5B9T2> I had no idea Julia had a Zulip. I will check it out. Thanks!

elements.text: . You are an inspiration. I am also a young scholar and lecturer, but you are way out of my league...
I had no idea Julia had a Zulip. I will check it out. Thanks!

text: Don't feel bad, no one is actually in his league :stuck_out_tongue:
